attributes.action: Stop Royal Mail subsidising postage costs for Chinese traders
attributes.additional_details:
China Post pays RM a fraction of the actual cost of delivering small packets within the UK. This is because China is classed as a “developing country.”  This is a huge subsidy to the Chinese.  It is cheaper to send airmail from China than for us to send something within the UK.
Two million items a week are thought to arrive each week from China. They are transported by air freight to the UK. Think of the carbon air-miles involved!

It’s no wonder why high street retailers are suffering and why UK manufacturing continues to decline.  Let’s stop subsiding Chinese imports NOW!
attributes.background: Chinese  exporters get subsidised postal costs from Royal Mail. RM charges China less than the real cost of delivery  within the UK . This is  due to outdated rules imposed by the United Nations.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because this would be the responsibility of the Royal Mail and not the UK Government or Parliament.
